member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the UIConnectionGroupInfo class that is empty and has the default initial capacity.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the UIConnectionGroupInfo class that contains elements copied from the specified collection and has sufficient capacity to accommodate the number of elements copied.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the UIConnectionGroupInfo class that is empty and has the specified initial capacity.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the UIConnectionGroupInfo class that contains a shallow copy of the items from another UIConnectionGroupInfo

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the UIConnectionGroupInfo class with a single item in the group

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.RegSvrEnum.UIConnectionGroupInfo.ShallowCopy
member.summary: Create a new collection containing the same objects this group contains
member.returns: The copy of the group

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.RegSvrEnum.UIConnectionGroupInfo.DeepCopy(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a new collection containing copies of the objects this group contains
member.param: Whether the copied connection objects should have new IDs. Set this to true if we want different connections. Set it to false if we want the copies to hash to the same values as their progenitors.
member.returns: The copy of the group

member.summary: The name of the group

True if the user name (with possibly the encrypted password) needs to be serialized to the XML stream; false, otherwise.

member.summary: Reads from an open XML Stream

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.RegSvrEnum.UIConnectionInfo.Copy
member.summary: Create a new connection info like this connection info.
member.remarks: Note that this generates a new id for the clone, so the clone does not exactly match its progenitor, which is useful if we are going to change some parameter in the new connection info.

member.summary: Comparison used for sorting connection info
